info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:24PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MCDOWELL...CALDWELL AND WESTERN BURKE COUNTIES... At 724 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Deep Gap to 7 miles east of Marion, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Morganton, Marion, Gamewell, Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, Table Rock, Lake James and Nebo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
